data.name: ResultRowError
data.value: Cannot perform this activity due to selected row status

data.name: CameraPermissionText
data.value: Camera permission has been denied for this application.

data.name: DefaultHelp
data.value:
Welcome to SampleManager Mobile

The Thermo Scientific™ SampleManager Mobile™ app lets you connect to Thermo Scientific™ SampleManager LIMS™ using a mobile device.

To access the operations available to you, either tap or swipe right.

If you do not see the operations or data that you expect, contact your system administrator.

data.name: EntitySelectionPageHelp
data.value:
Result Selection Screen

To select data items for result entry

  1. Select the check boxes beside the samples or tests for which you want to enter results.
  2. Tap Go.

data.name: EsignatureLayout.esigConsent.Text
data.value: Note: Completion of this form carries the same meaning and weight as a written signature.

data.name: Help.AuxiliaryPage
data.value:
Auxiliary Screens

The current screen is a SampleManager Mobile auxiliary screen, which lets you make a simple change to your data items.

Examples of auxiliary screens include:

  • Receive Samples
  • Move Samples

To change data items in an auxiliary screen

  1. Select the data items that you want to change.

    An area at the bottom of the screen shows a list of selected item IDs and prompts for the values to be changed.

  2. Enter values in the prompts.

    To browse for an entity:

    1. Tap . A list of entities that match the prompt criteria appear.
    2. To restrict the browse list to entities that match a specific text string, type the text in the Filter results field and tap Filter.
    3. Select the entity you want and tap OK.
  3. Tap Save to apply the value to all selected items.

    There is no confirmation of the operation. However, if it is unsuccessful, a message appears at the bottom of the screen.

data.name: Help.AuxSearchPage
data.value:
Mobile Search Screen

A mobile search lets you select the set of items for a task. For example, if you want to receive samples, you must first select the samples in the mobile app.

You can either use a predefined mobile search to find items, or you can enter item identities individually.

Select Items with a Mobile Search

Mobile searches are defined on your SampleManager server. You cannot create or modify them using SampleManager Mobile.

To find items with a mobile search

  1. Tap the mobile search you want to use.
  2. If prompts appear below the name of your mobile search, enter the values you are prompted for.

    To browse for an entity in a prompt:

    1. Tap . A list of entities that match the prompt criteria appear.
    2. To restrict the browse list to entities that match a specific text string, type the text in the Filter results field and tap Filter.
    3. Select the entity you want and tap OK.

    If appears in a prompt, the value you entered has failed validation. Enter a more appropriate value.

  3. Tap Search. A list of items appears. The items in the list match your search criteria and are compatible with the current operation.

Enter Item Identities

To enter item identities

  1. Tap Scan [items], where [items] is the type of item.
  2. In the dialog box that appears, use one of the following methods to enter the ID:
    • Scan the barcode using a barcode scanner connected to your device.
    • Tap Barcode Camera, and use the camera to read the barcode.
    • Type the ID into the Barcode prompt.
  3. Tap Add to add the item ID to the list below the Barcode prompt.
  4. Repeat steps 2 and 3 to build a list of item IDs.
  5. Tap OK to search the database for your data items and list them on the next screen.

The list always sorts items by identity, in ascending order. If a data item cannot be found, for example if you have entered an ID incorrectly, it does not appear in the list. At the bottom of the screen, a message appears that lists any IDs that cannot be found.

data.name: Help.EntitySelectionPage
data.value:
Result Selection Screen

To select data items for result entry

  1. Select the check boxes beside the samples or tests for which you want to enter results.
  2. Tap Go.

data.name: Help.EntitySelectionPage.LAB_EXECUTION
data.value:
Lab Execution Task Selection

To select the lab execution task that you want to work on

  1. Tap the lab execution task.
  2. Tap Execute.

Note The Execute button appears in the rightmost column of the list. You might need to scroll right to see the button.

data.name: Help.EntitySelectionPage.LAB_METHOD
data.value:
Lab Method Selection

To select the lab method that you want to create a task from

  1. Tap the lab method.
  2. Tap Execute.

Note The Execute button appears in the rightmost column of the list. You might need to scroll right to see the button.

data.name: Help.FavoritePage
data.value:
Mobile Search Screen

A mobile search lets you select the set of items for a task. For example, if you want to receive samples, you must first select the samples in the mobile app.

You can either use a predefined mobile search to find items, or you can enter item identities individually.

Select Items with a Mobile Search

Mobile searches are defined on your SampleManager server. You cannot create or modify them using SampleManager Mobile.

To find items with a mobile search

  1. Tap the mobile search you want to use.
  2. If prompts appear below the name of your mobile search, enter the values you are prompted for.

    To browse for an entity in a prompt:

    1. Tap . A list of entities that match the prompt criteria appear.
    2. To restrict the browse list to entities that match a specific text string, type the text in the Filter results field and tap Filter.
    3. Select the entity you want and tap OK.

    If appears in a prompt, the value you entered has failed validation. Enter a more appropriate value.

  3. Tap Search. A list of items appears. The items in the list match your search criteria and are compatible with the current operation.

Enter Item Identities

To enter item identities

  1. Tap Scan [items], where [items] is the type of item.
  2. In the dialog box that appears, use one of the following methods to enter the ID:
    • Scan the barcode using a barcode scanner connected to your device.
    • Tap Barcode Camera, and use the camera to read the barcode.
    • Type the ID into the Barcode prompt.
  3. Tap Add to add the item ID to the list below the Barcode prompt.
  4. Repeat steps 2 and 3 to build a list of item IDs.
  5. Tap OK to search the database for your data items and list them on the next screen.

The list always sorts items by identity, in ascending order. If a data item cannot be found, for example if you have entered an ID incorrectly, it does not appear in the list. At the bottom of the screen, a message appears that lists any IDs that cannot be found.

data.name: Help.FolderSearchPage
data.value:
Mobile Search Screen

A mobile search lets you select the set of items for a task. For example, if you want to receive samples, you must first select the samples in the mobile app.

You can either use a predefined mobile search to find items, or you can enter item identities individually.

Select Items with a Mobile Search

Mobile searches are defined on your SampleManager server. You cannot create or modify them using SampleManager Mobile.

To find items with a mobile search

  1. Tap the mobile search you want to use.
  2. If prompts appear below the name of your mobile search, enter the values you are prompted for.

    To browse for an entity in a prompt:

    1. Tap . A list of entities that match the prompt criteria appear.
    2. To restrict the browse list to entities that match a specific text string, type the text in the Filter results field and tap Filter.
    3. Select the entity you want and tap OK.

    If appears in a prompt, the value you entered has failed validation. Enter a more appropriate value.

  3. Tap Search. A list of items appears. The items in the list match your search criteria and are compatible with the current operation.

Enter Item Identities

To enter item identities

  1. Tap Scan [items], where [items] is the type of item.
  2. In the dialog box that appears, use one of the following methods to enter the ID:
    • Scan the barcode using a barcode scanner connected to your device.
    • Tap Barcode Camera, and use the camera to read the barcode.
    • Type the ID into the Barcode prompt.
  3. Tap Add to add the item ID to the list below the Barcode prompt.
  4. Repeat steps 2 and 3 to build a list of item IDs.
  5. Tap OK to search the database for your data items and list them on the next screen.

The list always sorts items by identity, in ascending order. If a data item cannot be found, for example if you have entered an ID incorrectly, it does not appear in the list. At the bottom of the screen, a message appears that lists any IDs that cannot be found.

data.name: Help.LabExecutionPage.Continue
data.value:
Continue Execution

In the Continue Execution screen, you can continue a lab execution task. The first step is to specify the lab execution task you want to work on. You can choose any task that is incomplete and assigned to your user account.

You can either enter the identity of the lab execution task directly, or find the identity using a predefined mobile search.

Select a Lab Execution Task with a Mobile Search

Mobile searches are defined on your SampleManager server. You cannot create or modify them using SampleManager Mobile.

To find a lab execution task with a mobile search

  1. Tap the mobile search you want to use.
  2. If prompts appear below the name of your mobile search, enter the values you are prompted for.

    To browse for a lab execution task in a prompt:

    1. Tap . A list of lab execution tasks that match the prompt criteria appear.
    2. To restrict the browse list to lab execution tasks that match a specific text string, type the text in the Filter results field and tap Filter.
    3. Select the lab execution task you want and tap OK.

    If appears in a prompt, the value you entered has failed validation. Enter a more appropriate value.

  3. Tap Search. A list of lab execution tasks appears. The lab execution tasks in the list match your search criteria and are compatible with the current operation.

Enter a Lab Execution Task Name

To enter a lab execution task name

  1. Tap Scan lab execution task.
  2. In the dialog box that appears, use one of the following methods to enter the name:
    • Scan the barcode using a barcode scanner connected to your device.
    • Tap Barcode Camera, and use the camera to read the barcode.
    • Type the name of the lab execution task into the Barcode prompt.
  3. Tap Add to add the lab execution task name to the list below the Barcode prompt.
  4. You can repeat steps 2 and 3 to build a list of lab execution task names.
  5. Tap OK to search the database for your lab execution tasks and list them on the next screen.

    The list always sorts lab execution tasks by identity, in ascending order. If a lab execution task cannot be found, for example if you have entered a name incorrectly, it does not appear in the list. At the bottom of the screen, a message appears that lists any lab execution tasks that cannot be found.

data.name: Help.LabExecutionStepPage
data.value:
Lab Execution Task Step

This page contains instructions for the current step in your lab execution task. The options available on the page depend on the configuration of the lab method that the task is based on.

Navigate Task Steps

Use the buttons at the lower right of the screen to navigate through the steps of your task. The buttons that appear in each step depend on the configuration of the lab method the task is based on. The standard buttons are:

  • Continue – Move to the next step. You can continue to the next step when you have entered all the required information for the current step.
  • Finish – Finish the lab execution task. The Finish button appears when the final step in the lab execution task is complete.
  • Back – Go back to the previous step.
  • Modify – Reopen a completed step so that you can change the data associated with that step.

To pause the execution of a step so that you can return to the task later, tap and then tap Pause. The information you have entered is saved and you can return to work on the task later using the Continue Execution option.

To stop execution of a task before you have completed all the steps, tap and then tap Stop. The information you have entered is saved, but you cannot return to work on the task further.

To see a list of the steps in your task, tap and then tap Steps.

View Substance Information

If a step is associated with one or more substances, the hazard pictograms for those substances appear on the screen. To view more detailed information about the substances, tap and then tap Substance.

Attach Photos

To attach a photo to a step

  1. Tap and then tap Attachments. The Attachments dialog box appears.
  2. Tap Add. The File Viewer appears.
  3. Tap Take Photo. The camera is activated.
  4. When you have taken the photo you want to use, tap Use Photo. The photo appears in the File Viewer.
  5. Tap Close to attach the photo to the step.

To view attached photos

  1. Tap and then tap Attachments. The Attachments dialog box appears.
  2. Tap View Image beside the name of the photo you want to see.

To change the name of an attached photo

  1. Tap and then tap Attachments. The Attachments dialog box appears.
  2. Tap Edit beside the name of the photo that has a name you want to change.
  3. Edit the name of the image.
  4. Tap Save.

Work with Batches

In SampleManager Mobile, you can create a batch, add samples to the batch, and edit the position of samples in the batch sequence.

To create a batch

  1. Tap the batch prompt and then tap Create.

    Alternatively, tap to browse for an existing batch.

  2. If you tapped Create in step 1, you must confirm that you want to create the batch. Tap Yes.
  3. Tap Continue. The next screen prompts you for the samples to add to the batch.
  4. Browse for each sample and then click Continue.
  5. If the lab method lets you view the batch sequence, tap and then tap Sequence. The batch sequence appears.
  6. If the batch uses a rack template and the lab method lets you modify the sequence, you can change the Rack Location of each entry in the sequence. Click OK to save your changes.

Work with Chromeleon Sequences

In SampleManager Mobile, you can create a Chromeleon sequence, add samples to the sequence, and edit the position of samples in the sequence.

To create a Chromeleon Sequence

  1. Tap the Chromeleon sequence prompt and then tap Create.

    Alternatively, tap to browse for an existing Chromeleon sequence.

  2. If you tapped Create in step 1, you must confirm that you want to create the sequence. Tap Yes.
  3. Tap Continue. The next screen prompts you for the samples to add to the sequence.
  4. Browse for each sample and then click Continue.
  5. If the lab method lets you view the sequence, tap and then tap Sequence. The sequence appears.
  6. If the lab method lets you modify the sequence, you can change the Rack Location of each entry in the sequence. Click OK to save your changes.

Read Values from an Instrument

To read a value from an instrument, tap Read.

Instrument connections are defined in the laboratory method. You cannot define an instrument connection in SampleManager mobile.

Add Comments

To add a comment to a step

  1. Tap and then tap Comments.
  2. Enter your comment and tap Close.

Browse for an Entity

To browse for an entity in a prompt

  1. Tap . A list of entities that match the prompt criteria appear.
  2. To restrict the browse list to entities that match a specific text string, type the text in the Filter results field and tap Filter.
  3. Select the entity you want and tap OK.

data.name: Help.LesExecutionPage.Create
data.value:
Create Execution

In the Create Execution screen, you can start the process of creating a lab execution task. The first step in the process is to specify the lab method you want to base your new task on.

You can either enter the identity of the lab execution method directly, or find the identity using a predefined mobile search.

Select a Lab Method with a Mobile Search

Mobile searches are defined on your SampleManager server. You cannot create or modify them using SampleManager Mobile.

To find a lab method with a mobile search

  1. Tap the mobile search you want to use.
  2. If prompts appear below the name of your mobile search, enter the values you are prompted for.

    To browse for a lab method in a prompt:

    1. Tap . A list of lab methods that match the prompt criteria appear.
    2. To restrict the browse list to lab methods that match a specific text string, type the text in the Filter results field and tap Filter.
    3. Select the lab method you want and tap OK.

    If appears in a prompt, the value you entered has failed validation. Enter a more appropriate value.

  3. Tap Search. A list of lab methods appears. The lab methods in the list match your search criteria and are compatible with the current operation.

Enter a Lab Method Name

To enter a lab method name

  1. Tap Scan lab method.
  2. In the dialog box that appears, use one of the following methods to enter the name:
    • Scan the barcode using a barcode scanner connected to your device.
    • Tap Barcode Camera, and use the camera to read the barcode.
    • Type the name of the lab method into the Barcode prompt.
  3. Tap Add to add the lab method name to the list below the Barcode prompt.
  4. You can repeat steps 2 and 3 to build a list of lab method names.
  5. Tap OK to search the database for your lab methods and list them on the next screen.

The list always sorts lab methods by identity, in ascending order. If a lab method cannot be found, for example if you have entered a name incorrectly, it does not appear in the list. At the bottom of the screen, a message appears that lists any lab methods that cannot be found.

data.name: Help.LoginPage
data.value:
Login Screen

When the SampleManager Mobile app starts, the Login screen appears.

From the Login screen, you can:

  • Open the Server Setup screen, where you can create, edit, and delete server connections.
  • Log in to SampleManager Mobile using one of the following mechanisms:
    • SampleManager Authentication: When you use this mechanism, you are required to enter a preconfigured username and password. User settings are managed using records in SampleManager. This is the default authentication mechanism. For instructions on how to log in to SampleManager Mobile, see the procedure below. For information about setting up and managing a user, see the "Security" chapter of the SampleManager System Administrator Guide. For information about how to log in, see Log in to SampleManager Mobile.
    • Domain Authentication: When you use this mechanism, your user name and password are verified by a domain controller on the network. When domain authentication is used, SampleManager can be configured to either prompt the user for their domain username and password on login, or to obtain the username and password information from the current Windows session on the client (proxy login). For more information about domain authentication in SampleManger, see the "Security" chapter of the SampleManager System Administrator Guide.
    • Touch ID: When you use this mechanism, you can use your fingerprint to log in to SampleManager Mobile. For more information about how to configure Touch ID, see the "Introduction" chapter in the SampleManager Mobile Configuration Guide. Details are located in the "Touch ID" section. For information about how to log in using Touch ID, see Log in to SampleManager Mobile.
  • Open the Options menu to access logging, customization, and system information options For information about the options on the Options menu, see Options Menu.

Login to SampleManager Mobile

This topic contains the instructions to log in to SampleManager Mobile.

To log in to SampleManager Mobile using your username and password

  1. On the Login screen, type your username and password.
  2. Choose a SampleManager server connection from the list.

    If the server you want does not appear on the Servers list, add the server using the Server Setup screen.

  3. Tap Login.

Note If SampleManager Mobile downloads new resources from the server, it might restart before it logs in.

If your login credentials are valid, the app connects to the SampleManager instance and the resources on the mobile device synchronize with the resources on the SampleManager application server.

You can also log in to SampleManager Mobile using Touch ID. For information on configuring Touch ID for use on your device, see the "Introduction" chapter in the SampleManager Mobile Configuration Guide. Details are located in the "Touch ID" section.

CAUTION Due to the way that Android, iOS, and Windows mobile devices handle fingerprint authentication, any fingerprint record stored on a device can be used to verify the credentials of the SampleManager user who enabled Touch ID on the device.

SampleManager user credentials are not associated with any particular fingerprint record. When using Touch ID, the SampleManager Mobile application verifies that the fingerprint matches any stored fingerprint record on the device. Therefore, any person who has a stored fingerprint record on the device can authenticate the user credentials of the SampleManager user who enabled Touch ID.

The user who enables Touch ID on the device is responsible for all transactions on the device. To maintain proper security precautions when using SampleManager Mobile with Touch ID enabled, we recommend the following:

– Limit the use of Touch ID to only one SampleManager user per device.

– Limit the fingerprint records stored on the device to only the user who uses Touch ID.

To log in to SampleManager Mobile using Touch ID

  1. On the Login screen, tap the Login with Touch ID icon

    A message box appears that indicates the username currently associated with the Touch ID feature.

  2. Confirm that the username that appears in the message box corresponds to your user credentials, and then place your finger on the device home button or the fingerprint reader for your device to log in. If you want to use your password to log in or if the username indicated in the message box does not correspond to your user credentials, click Cancel in the message box.

If the fingerprint matches a valid fingerprint record on the device, the app connects to the SampleManager instance and the resources on the mobile device synchronize with the resources on the SampleManager application server.

Log Out

To log out of the SampleManager Mobile application

  1. Perform one of the following:
    • Tap Logout located at the top right on your device.

      When using a Windows device, tap the More button at the top right of your screen, and then tap Logout.

    • Tap to open the options menu, tap Logged in as, and then tap Logout.

    A message appears asking to confirm logout.

  2. Tap Yes to logout, or No to return to the app.

If you are not active for 15 minutes, an application timeout occurs and you are automatically logged out and returned to the Login page. You must enter your credentials on the Login page to continue your session.

Options Menu

The operations that are available in the mobile app can be accessed from the Options menu.

To open the Options menu, use one of the following methods:

  • Tap in the application title bar.
  • Swipe from the left edge of the screen, when Options Menu Swipe option is enabled (iOS and Androind devices only).For more information about Options Menu Swipe option, see the Mobile App Overview section in the Introduction chapter of the "SampleManager Mobile Configuration Guide," Details are in the Enable or Disable the Options Menu Swipe section.

Note There are options available prior to log in. These options might differ from those available after log in.

The options available to you depend on the following criteria:

  • The master menu option appears in the popup menu of at least one folder that you can access in the Mobile Folders cabinet.
  • Your user account grants access to the master menu option.
  • If you are logged into the application or not.

The following list contains the typical submenu options and a description of the functions they contain. Expand and collapse these items to view or hide additional features.

Actions – Contains the available action options for the samples and tests assigned to you. The options available depend on your user account access.

Visual – Contains the options to personalize the SampleManager Mobile user interface. Access this submenu to change or apply a theme, adjust the text and button size, and enable or disable swiping to view or close the Options menu. For more information about the options available, see the SampleManger Mobile Configuration Guide.

Setup – Contains configurations items such as server management, Touch ID usage, and user interface configuration. For more information about the options available, see the SampleManger Mobile Configuration Guide.

Logging – Contains the options for administering and managing performance and error logs.

Help and About – Contains links to the Help and the About page for the SampleManager Mobile application installed on your device.

  • The Help...
  • The About page contains information about the SampleManger Mobile application installed on your device. The information that appears includes the application version. If you are logged in to the application, you can also view the API service information including, but not limited to the instance, the information about the current user, the product name, the server details, the executable path, and the service file references.

Logged in as – Indicates the user currently logged in on the device and provides an option to log out.

For more information, ...

data.name: Help.LogPage
data.value:
Log Viewer Screen

The Log Viewer screen lets you configure the logging and appearance of SampleManager Mobile.

To change the appearance of the app, choose a theme from the list. The app appearance changes immediately.

You can record, examine, and clear log entries for SampleManager Mobile:

  • To start recording log entries, select Logging Enable.
  • To view a list of log entries, choose either Exception Logs or Performance Logs from the list.
  • To clear the currently shown log, tap Clear. All log entries are deleted permanently.

data.name: Help.PromptPopupPage
data.value:
Mobile Search Screen

A mobile search lets you select the set of items for a task. For example, if you want to receive samples, you must first select the samples in the mobile app.

You can either use a predefined mobile search to find items, or you can enter item identities individually.

Select Items with a Mobile Search

Mobile searches are defined on your SampleManager server. You cannot create or modify them using SampleManager Mobile.

To find items with a mobile search

  1. Tap the mobile search you want to use.
  2. If prompts appear below the name of your mobile search, enter the values you are prompted for.

    To browse for an entity in a prompt:

    1. Tap . A list of entities that match the prompt criteria appear.
    2. To restrict the browse list to entities that match a specific text string, type the text in the Filter results field and tap Filter.
    3. Select the entity you want and tap OK.

    If appears in a prompt, the value you entered has failed validation. Enter a more appropriate value.

  3. Tap Search. A list of items appears. The items in the list match your search criteria and are compatible with the current operation.

Enter Item Identities

To enter item identities

  1. Tap Scan [items], where [items] is the type of item.
  2. In the dialog box that appears, use one of the following methods to enter the ID:
    • Scan the barcode using a barcode scanner connected to your device.
    • Tap Barcode Camera, and use the camera to read the barcode.
    • Type the ID into the Barcode prompt.
  3. Tap Add to add the item ID to the list below the Barcode prompt.
  4. Repeat steps 2 and 3 to build a list of item IDs.
  5. Tap OK to search the database for your data items and list them on the next screen.

The list always sorts items by identity, in ascending order. If a data item cannot be found, for example if you have entered an ID incorrectly, it does not appear in the list. At the bottom of the screen, a message appears that lists any IDs that cannot be found.

data.name: Help.ResultEntryPage
data.value:
Result Entry Screen

To enter results

  1. For each of your results, tap the prompt in its Value column and enter its result value.

    To add a photo as the value of a file result:

    1. Tap Add Image to open a File Viewer window.
    2. Tap Take Photo.
    3. When you have taken the photo you want to use, tap Use Photo. The photo appears in the File Viewer.
    4. Tap Close to add the photo to the file result.

    To browse for an entity in an entity result:

    1. Tap . A list of entities that match the prompt criteria appear.
    2. To restrict the browse list to entities that match a specific text string, type the text in the Filter results field and tap Filter.
    3. Select the entity you want and tap OK.
  2. When you have entered values for all your results, tap Save.

If any results fail to meet specifications or cannot be saved, warning or error messages appear.

data.name: Help.ServerSetupPage
data.value:
Server Connections

To create a server connection

  1. Tap to open the options menu.
  2. Tap Setup > Server Setup.

    The Servers page appears.

  3. Tap at the bottom of the screen on the right.
  4. In the Display Name field, type a name for the server connection.

    Each server connection on the device must have a unique name.

  5. In the Web API Address field, type the URL of the WCF Service for the SampleManager instance.

    Ask your system administrator for the URL information.

  6. Tap Test Connection to confirm the connection to the SampleManager instance was successfully created.
  7. Tap OK after you confirm the connection is successful.

To edit a server connection

  1. Choose a server connection on the Servers page.
  2. Tap Edit.
  3. Modify the server connection details.
  4. Tap OK.

To delete a server connection

  1. Choose a server connection on the Servers page.
  2. Tap DELETE.
  3. Tap Yes to confirm the deletion.

data.name: Help.HomeTabPage
data.value:
Mobile Search Screen

A mobile search lets you select the set of items for a task. For example, if you want to receive samples, you must first select the samples in the mobile app.

You can either use a predefined mobile search to find items, or you can enter item identities individually.

Select Items with a Mobile Search

Mobile searches are defined on your SampleManager server. You cannot create or modify them using SampleManager Mobile.

To find items with a mobile search

  1. Tap the mobile search you want to use.
  2. If prompts appear below the name of your mobile search, enter the values you are prompted for.

    To browse for an entity in a prompt:

    1. Tap . A list of entities that match the prompt criteria appear.
    2. To restrict the browse list to entities that match a specific text string, type the text in the Filter results field and tap Filter.
    3. Select the entity you want and tap OK.

    If appears in a prompt, the value you entered has failed validation. Enter a more appropriate value.

  3. Tap Search. A list of items appears. The items in the list match your search criteria and are compatible with the current operation.

Enter Item Identities

To enter item identities

  1. Tap Scan [items], where [items] is the type of item.
  2. In the dialog box that appears, use one of the following methods to enter the ID:
    • Scan the barcode using a barcode scanner connected to your device.
    • Tap Barcode Camera, and use the camera to read the barcode.
    • Type the ID into the Barcode prompt.
  3. Tap Add to add the item ID to the list below the Barcode prompt.
  4. Repeat steps 2 and 3 to build a list of item IDs.
  5. Tap OK to search the database for your data items and list them on the next screen.

The list always sorts items by identity, in ascending order. If a data item cannot be found, for example if you have entered an ID incorrectly, it does not appear in the list. At the bottom of the screen, a message appears that lists any IDs that cannot be found.

data.name: LabExecutionPage.NotSaveConfirmation
data.value: Navigating to another step will result in loss of unsaved data. Are you sure you wish to continue?

data.name: LESReadError.Message
data.value: Server was not able to read instrument value(s). Please check your parameter configuration.
